Talk1059: <sp:3:0:2:0901>This is my wagon! You can't take it!
Talk1060:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Tired_01>Grr, that's enough! Please stop touching
my wagon!
Talk1061:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Think_01>My poor wagon. Maybe I have to admit
it's a lost cause, and... <sp:5:1:0>Hm?
Talk1063:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseM_01>Is that your...um...<sp:5:1:0>


<clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>That's not even a horse, is it?<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0700>I-I don't think it's right for my
horse-drawn wagon. But whatever it is,
it's certainly, um...unique.
Talk1016: <sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal>Thanks to you, my wagon has wheels!<sp:0:4:0>All that's left is to catch a <clr:0000>wild horse<clr:ffff>...
Talk1066:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Ease_00>I see. Well, I wish I was as good at
catching horses as you are.
Talk1019:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><clr:0000><snd:Think_01><clr:ffff>I have to use <clr:0000>building materials <clr:ffff>to fix
the wheels, catch a <clr:0000>wild horse<clr:ffff>...

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Urgh! It's so much work!
Talk1067:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS>Is that... Is that animal yours?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I don't think it's right for my horse-drawn
wagon, but I like how cute and wild
it looks.
Talk1068:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer, already?<sp:5:1:0> Early bird, huh?


I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1024:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00><sp:0:2:2:5000>Fine, don't offer to help. Yeesh!


<clr:0200>It's not as if I wouldn't pay you back. I'd give you
literally all my savings, in fact!<clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk1072:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I'm only one step away from having a
horse-drawn wagon, and yet...
Talk1074:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer, already?<sp:5:1:0> Early bird, huh?


I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1075:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> Hi there, and welcome to
New Serenne Stable.<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1076:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> Folks don't usually drop
by this late at night!<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1077:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> You'd better go inside.
Don't want to get wet, do you?<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk3004:
<sp:3:0:2:0901><snd:Angry_00>Ex<sp:5:0:0>cuse <sp:5:0:0>me. Didn't I tell you to stop
touching my wagon?
Talk1030: <sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Happy_00>Did you catch this angel for me?
Talk3005:
Someday, that'll be a beautiful
<clr:0000>horse-drawn wagon<clr:ffff>!
Talk1078:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Happy_00>Is this horse yours? What a cutie! And so
well-mannered too!
Talk1031:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thank you! <sp:5:0:0>Wow, who knew stuff like this
really happened?<sp:0:4:0>I'm so, so happy!
Talk3006:
Do you want to break it even more than
it's already broken? Hm?<sp:0:4:0>Please, just leave my future <clr:0000>horse-drawn
wagon <clr:ffff>alone!
Talk1080:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Oh, I have a <clr:0000>harness<clr:ffff> already, so I'll swap
out the one you used.
Talk1079: <sp:3:0:2:0100>I'll just go ahead and put a <clr:0000>harness<clr:ffff> on it.
Talk3007:
I get that you're curious about Zunk, but
c'mon! You're going to agitate the horse!
Talk1082:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseL_00>On second thought, it doesn't look quite
right. <sp:5:1:0>Did you do this?
Talk3008:
What if the horse started kicking and
damaged Zunk?
Talk1083:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Your horse is important to you, huh?
I understand. If only I was any good at
catching wild horses...
Talk1035:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Greeting_00>A <clr:0000>harness<clr:ffff> is a piece of equipment that
you can put on horses you own.<sp:0:4:0>With a <clr:0000>harness<clr:ffff>, you can <clr:0000>connect <clr:ffff>your
horse to a wagon or an item you need to
take somewhere.
<sp:3:0:2:0801>If you collect enough <clr:0000>Pony Points<clr:ffff>,
you can get one as a prize!
Talk1084:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>It's just what I pictured. Perfect for pulling
my wagon!
Talk1085:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> Hi there, and welcome to
New Serenne Stable.<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1086:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> Folks don't usually drop
by this late at night!<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1087:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> Good thing you got here
before nightfall.<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1040:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I can't believe it! <sp:5:0:0>A wagon of my own,
and a beautiful horse to pull it.

To think I started with that old piece of
junk, and ended up with this. <sp:5:0:0>Amazing.

<snd:LaughL_00>Thank you so, so, SO much. <sp:5:0:0>Here.<sp:5:0:0> It's all
I have left after buying the wagon.<sp:5:0:0>

I'm begging you—no,<sp:5:0:0> forcing you to
take it. Please!
Talk1088:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> Good thing you got here
before nightfall.<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1041:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Now I'm only one step away from my
dream of having a horse-drawn wagon.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_01>Of course, that last hurdle is the hardest.
Catching a <clr:0000>wild horse<clr:ffff>...
Talk1089:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, a customer?<sp:5:1:0> You'd better go inside.
Don't want to get wet, do you?<sp:0:4:0>I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of something<clr:ffff>,
but if you'd like to use the stable, you can
go up to the counter.
Talk1090:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00><sp:0:2:2:5000>*sigh* Why is no one offering to help? If they did,
I'd give them all my money! Every last rupee!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk1100:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>Are you a stable member? <sp:5:1:0>No? Then by
all means, go up to the stable counter and
register for a membership!
Talk1091:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Happy_01>Thank you, but I don't think it will roll if
the wheels are like this.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01>The two of them should both <clr:0000>click<clr:ffff>
into place.
Talk1043:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_00>Oh, that's right... <sp:5:0:0>There's one last order
of business. <sp:5:0:0>What's your name?
Talk1044:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_00>After a long, tireless search, I found a
wagon to call my own!

Look at this beaut!
Talk1092:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I appreciate the thought, I really do. But
without <clr:0000>wagon wheels<clr:ffff>, it's not going to
roll very far...
Talk1045:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Chat_00>There's a stash of unused <clr:0000>building
materials <clr:ffff>at every stable.<sp:0:4:0>No two stashes will have the exact
same materials.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>But they do have one thing in common—
they're open for everyone to use, no
questions asked!
Talk1093:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thank you so, <sp:5:0:0>so much!<sp:0:4:0>It's like a brand-new wagon, <sp:5:0:0>with wheels
and everything!
Talk1046:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>If you catch a <clr:0000>wild horse<clr:ffff>, you can make it
your own.<sp:0:4:0>There are lots of them around here, as a
matter of fact.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>It's hard to catch them though... You
have to <clr:0000>crouch<clr:ffff> down and sneak up on
them, or they'll run away.
Talk1094:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Well, I say that, but with the <clr:0000>wagon
wheels detached<clr:ffff>, this horse doesn't
have anything to pull.
<sp:3:0:2:0801>I'll have it wait in the stable for now!
Talk1047:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00><sp:0:2:2:5000>Fine, don't offer to help. Yeesh! Do I look like I can
fix a horse-drawn wagon on my own?

<clr:0200>It's not as if I wouldn't pay you back. I'd give you
all my savings, in fact!<clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk1095:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS_01>Great! <sp:5:0:0>That's the hard part done with!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>Thanks to you, I'm only one step away
from having a wagon of my own.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>All that's left is using the stable's
<clr:0000>building materials <clr:ffff>to repair the wheels...
Talk1001:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad_01>Sorry, but I'm kind of <clr:0000>in the middle of
something <clr:ffff>right now...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>If you'd like to use the stable, you can go
up to the counter.
Talk1048:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00>As soon as I get near a <clr:0000>wild horse<clr:ffff>, it runs
off. How am I going to catch one?
Talk1096:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_00>But I... <sp:5:1:0>I'm super, super, suuuper bad at
that sort of detailed work...
Talk1050:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:Notice>Huh?<sp:5:0:0> You mean that? <sp:5:0:0>You'd really part
with such a wonderful horse?
Talk1097:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>All I gotta do now is put a <clr:0000>harness <clr:ffff>on
the horse and tether it to the wagon.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughL_00>Then my <clr:0000>horse-drawn wagon will be done<clr:ffff>!
Talk1003:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:QuestionNormal_00>OK...yes. Clearly it's a fixer-upper.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>But I can replace the missing wheels using
<clr:0000>building materials<clr:ffff> from the stable.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>Then I just have to catch a <clr:0000>wild horse <clr:ffff>to
hook the wagon up to, and I'll be set!
Talk1099:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Since you gave me a horse, the only thing
left is to repair the wagon wheels using
these <clr:0000>building materials<clr:ffff>.
Talk1052:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>Is that... Is that your horse?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I don't think it's right for my horse-drawn
wagon, but it's quite beautiful!
Talk1053:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_00>Huh? Wha?! <sp:5:1:0>There's something stuck to
my wagon...
Talk1006: <sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_00>Huh? Wha?! My wagon! It's...<sp:5:1:0> Hold on.
Talk1054: <sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad_00>You tried to fix it for me, huh?
Talk1007: <sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>It's fixed! <sp:5:1:0>Did you do this for me?<sp:5:1:0>
Talk1055:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Link? <sp:5:0:0>Hmm. Zumi... <sp:5:1:0>Link...<sp:0:4:0><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>Maybe...<sp:5:0:0>Zuli? Or...<sp:5:0:0>Lumi? Or what about...<sp:5:0:0>Zunk!<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>


I'll call this wagon Zunk! <sp:5:0:0>Heh heh!
<sp:5:0:0>I promise to look after Zunk for as
long as I live!<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:LaughS_01><clr:0200>Feel free to come visit the two of us anytime! <sp:5:0:0>Hehe!<clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk1056:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>Even after you DO catch one, you have to
<clr:0000>soothe<clr:ffff> the horse or you'll get thrown off.
I always mess that part up...
